title: Drawing, ca. 1765
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and brown and gray wash; black chalk
inscribed: In pen and black ink across lower margin: The open of the chimney is 4 by 5 in proportion
provenance: Ex-Collection: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Front view of a mantelpiece with frieze of decorative figures . Additional ornamentation is added on right half, including a winged gryphon at lower right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1765.
ca. 1765. Pen and black ink; brush and brown and gray wash; black chalk. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5294.
